intro: Languas blepharocalyx var. glabrior, commonly known as the smooth-flowered lanugo, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its woolly, soft leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
